title: Count Word Frequency
description: Given a string of text, return an object/map where keys are words and values are the frequency (count) of those words. Words should be lowercased and cleaned of punctuation.
constraints: Case and punctuation must be ignored.

examples.explanation: Both 'Apple' and 'apple.' count as the same word, 'apple'.

hints: Remove punctuation before splitting the text into words.
Use a dictionary to store and increment the count for each word.
solution_code:
import re
from collections import Counter

def count_word_frequency(text):
    # Convert to lowercase
    text = text.lower()
    
    # Remove punctuation and split into words (using re.findall to handle various separators)
    words = re.findall(r'\b\w+\b', text)
    
    # Use Counter for the most efficient word counting
    return dict(Counter(words))
